docs.snippet: A communication from the Secretary of the Navy was received in answer to answer to the resolution asking why the Naval Academy had been removed from Annapolis.
docs.lead_paragraph: A communication from the Secretary of the Navy was received in answer to answer to the resolution asking why the Naval Academy had been removed from Annapolis.

docs.snippet: The United States steam transport Fulion, Commander WOTTON, arrived yesterday from Ship Island, (Miss.,) which port she left on the 13th inst., at 1 P.M.

docs.snippet: GENERAL: I have the honor to report that, after embarking the troops with which I intended to attack Newbern, in conjunction with the naval force, on the morning of the 11th, a rendezvous was made at Hatieras Inlet.

headline.main: THE BATTLE OF NEWBERN.; Gen. Burnside's Official Report to the War Department. Additional Particulars from Our Special Correspondent. Great Strength of the Rebel Fortifications. CONDITION OF AFFAIRS IN NEWBERN. OFFICIAL DISPATCH OF GEN. BURNSIDE. Additional Details from Our Special Correspondent.THE REBEL FORTIFICATIONS. Boarding of the Bark Evening Star.

docs.lead_paragraph: GENERAL: I have the honor to report that, after embarking the troops with which I intended to attack Newbern, in conjunction with the naval force, on the morning of the 11th, a rendezvous was made at Hatieras Inlet.

headline.main: JACKSONVILLE.; NEWS FROM PORT ROYAL. NEWS FROM FERNANDINA. OUR PORT ROYAL CORRESPONDENCE. PROBABLE EARLY CAPTURE OF SAVANNAH A SAD AFFAIRS ON OTTER ISLAND THE COTTON AND CONTRABAND QUESTION MISTAKEN PHILANTHROPY. FROM ANOTHER CORRESPONDENT. EXPEDITION TO JACKSONVILLE DESERTERS FROM SAVANNAH THE CONDITION OF THE CITY AND ITS DEFENCES SMALL-POX AMONG THE NEGROES

docs.snippet: In your well-merited rebuke of the traitor YULER, which appeared in your edition of the 19th inst., you were led into an error which I am sure you  will correct, as it reflects majustly upon the loyalty of a large religious body of the community.
docs.lead_paragraph: In your well-merited rebuke of the traitor YULER, which appeared in your edition of the 19th inst., you were led into an error which I am sure you will correct, as it reflects majustly upon the loyalty of a large religious body of the community.

docs.snippet: Brig.-Gen. BURNSIDE was, this afternoon, confirmed by the Senate as Major-General of Volunteers.

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; The Gallant Burnside Confirmed as Major-General. A Portion of Banks' Command Gone to Manassas. A Stream of Travel to Centreville and Bull Run.Iron-Glad Vessels Coming in Favorwith Congress.The Proposed General Bankrupt Law.OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES. GEN. BURNSIDE A MAJOR-GENERAL.

docs.lead_paragraph: Brig.-Gen. BURNSIDE was, this afternoon, confirmed by the Senate as Major-General of Volunteers.
